DOL APPLICATION CHECKLIST:THIS PROJECT WILL INVOLVE IMPROVEMENTS AT BUS STOPS THROUGHOUT THE U.S ROUTE 1 (RICHMOND HIGHWAY) CORRIDOR IN FAIRFAX COUNTY. FUNDING FOR THIS PROJECT IS EARMARKED UNDER THE FY 2003 JOB ACCESS PROGRAM. THESE IMPROVEMENTS WILL INCLUDE: BUS SHELTERS WITH BENCHES AND TRASH RECEPTACLES; STREET LIGHTING; AND SIDEWALKS AND PEDESTRIAN IMPROVEMENTS SUCH AS CROSSWALKS COUNTDOWN SIGNAL HEADS PAVEMENT MARKINGS SIGNAGE MEDIAN REFUGES AND PEDESTRIAN CHANNELING. THE BENEFITS OF THIS PROJECT WILL BE IMPROVED ACCESS TO EMPLOYMENT PEDESTRIAN SAFETY MORE ATTRACTIVE BUS SERVICES AND PROJECTS THAT WILL COMPLEMENT DEVELOPMENT IN THE SURROUNDING TRANSIT FRIENDLY COMMUNITIES. THE SHELTERS WILL BE LOCATED NEAR THE TYPES OF DEVELOPMENT THAT SUPPORT EMPLOYMENT AND THE USE OF PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION INCLUDING HIGH DENSITY RESIDENTIAL AREAS EMPLOYMENT CENTERS SOCIAL SERVICE AGENCIES LIBRARIES AFFORDABLE APARTMENT COMPLEXES COMMUNITY SHOPPING CENTERS AND RECREATION CENTERS. ALSO MOST OF THESE BUS STOPS ARE SERVED BY MULTIPLE BUS ROUTES MANY OF WHICH PROVIDE PEAK NON PEAK AND WEEKEND SERVICE. EACH OF THESE BUS STOPS HAVE 100 OR MORE WEEKDAY PASSENGER BOARDINGS. THE NEW SHELTERS WILL PROVIDE TRANSIT DEPENDENT EMPLOYEES WITH SAFE EASILY ACCESSIBLE CLEAN AND COMFORTABLE PLACES TO WAIT FOR BUSES WHICH WILL HELP TO ACHIEVE THE REGIONS GOALS OF ENCOURAGING TRANSIT RIDERSHIP PROVIDING ACCESS TO JOBS IMPROVING ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY AND REDUCING TRAFFIC CONGESTION.

THIS IS A PUERTO RICO HIGHWAY AND TRANSPORTATION AUTHORITY (PRHTA) GRANT IN THE AMOUNT OF $1100000 OF THE ELIGIBLE ($3626498) UNDER THE JOB ACCESS AND REVERSE COMMUTE (JARC) PROGRAM IN FY 2008 FOR THE MUNICIPALITY OF CAGUAS IN SAN JUAN URBANIZED AREA FORMULA PROGRAM SECTION 5316 OF THE FEDERAL TRANSIT ADMINISTRATION (FTA) FOR THE FOLLOWING PROJECTS:A. $577200 ACQUISITION OF EIGHT (8) MINI-BUSES WITH 16 PASSENGER CAPACITY TO CREATE A SYSTEM TO INCREASE THE PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION OPTIONS TO THE LOW INCOME AREA WORKERS. THE CAGUAS PROGRAM WOULD PROVIDE A MUCH NEEDED MEANS OF TRANSPORTATION TO WORKERS TO AND FROM THEIR WORKPLACE AND WILL COVER TWO (2) ROUTES. THE PEAK HOURS LAID DOWN WILL BE FROM 6:00 AM - 9:00 AM AND FROM 3:00 PM - 7:00 PM. TO ENSURE THE FREQUENCY IN PEAK HOURS 2 VEHICLES IN EACH DIRECTION WILL BE NECESSARY AT PEAK HOURS AND 1 VEHICLE WILL BE NECESSARY DURING NORMAL HOURS NOT PEAKS. ACCORDINGLY EACH ROUTES WILL REQUIRE 4 VEHICLE. SERVICE WILL BE PROVIDED FROM MONDAY TO SATURDAY. B. $64000 - ACQUISITION OF FOUR (4) BICYCLE STORAGE STATIONS AT TRANSIT STATIONS. THE CAGUAS JARC PROJECT WOULD ALLOW FOR THE DEVELOPMENT OF FOUR (4) NEW ROUTES TO SERVE THE SPECIFIC POPULATIONS DESCRIBED FURTHER HEREIN VIA THE USE OF EIGHT (8) BUSES THAT WILL TRANSPORT INDIVIDUALS WHO HAVE NO OTHER EFFECTIVE MEANS OF REACHING THEIR WORKPLACES. A PORTION OF SAID POPULATION MAY HAVE ALTERNATIVE MEANS OF TRANSPORTATION SUCH AS BICYCLE REASON WHY WE PROPOSE THAT IN FOUR (4) OF THOSE EIGHT (8) BUS STATIONS WE INCORPORATE BICYCLE STATIONS WHERE USERS OF THE SYSTEM CAN REACH THE BUS NETWORK ALLOWING THEM TO REACH MUCH LONGER DISTANCES THAN A BICYCLE COULD ALLOW AND UNDER SAFER CONDITIONS.C. $96000 ACQUISITION OF GPS LOCATOR AND SENSORS FOR MINI-BUSES AND BUS STATIONS. THIS WILL BE ACCOMPLISHED BY CREATING A SYSTEM OF EIGHT (8) BUSES THAT WILL HAVE INTEGRATED GPS SO THAT THEIR LOCATION MOVEMENTS FREQUENCY AND STOPS CAN BE MONITORED FROM A CENTRALLY LOCATED FACILITY THAT WILL MONITOR THE ENTIRE SYSTEM. THE ROUTES TO BE ASSIGNED WILL INCLUDE EIGHT (8) BUS STOPS THAT WILL BE EQUIPPED WITH GPS SENSORS THAT INTEGRATE WITH THE GPS INSTALLED IN THE BUSES FOR A SMARTER SYSTEM THAT ALLOWS THE CONTROL CENTER TO MONITOR AND IMPROVE FREQUENCIES ROUTES LOWER DELAYS AND ATTEND TO PEAK HOURS.D. $41600 DESIGN AND CONSTRUCTION OF EIGHT (8) BUS SHELTERS. EIGHT (8) SHELTERS DISTRIBUTED IN TWO NEW ROUTE. EACH ROUTES WILL INCLUDE FOUR (4) STOPS FOR A TOTAL TRAVEL TIME OF 25 MINUTES FOR THE ENTIRE EACH ROUTE. FOR THIS 25 MINUTE TRAVEL TIME GOAL THE BUSES WILL NEED TO HAVE A BUS STOP FREQUENCY OF EVERY 15 MINUTES DURING PEAK HOURS AND EACH 25 MINUTES DURING NORMAL HOURS.E. $211200 TRANSPORTATION VOUCHER PROGRAM. AS AN INCENTIVE FOR THE PRIVATE COMPANIES THAT CURRENTLY PROVIDE PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION IN ORDER TO INCREASE THE SERVICE BEYOND THE TWO ROUTES IDENTIFIED IN OUR PROGRAM. THE DESIGNED TRANSPORTATION VOUCHER PROGRAM (HEREINAFTER THE JARC/TVP) THAT COULD PROVIDE JOB ACCESS AND REVERSE COMMUTE TO AT LEAST 325 PARTICIPANTS WHO ARE ELIGIBLE AND WOULD NEED SUCH SERVICE IN ORDER TO REACH THEIR WORKPLACES. THE JARC/TVP WOULD WORK AS A PARTNERSHIP BETWEEN THE GRANTEE (MUNICIPALITY OF CAGUAS) AND THE LOCAL WORKFORCE INVESTMENT BOARD KNOWN BY ITS SPANISH ACRONYM AS AMSI. UNDER SAID PARTNERSHIP AMSI WOULD ADMINISTER CAGUASS JARC/TVP INCLUDING QUALIFYING THE ELIGIBLE POPULATION ISSUING THE VOUCHERS DISTRIBUTING THEM AND THE EVENTUAL REDEMPTION OF THE VOUCHERS BY THE PBLICO DRIVERS. THESE ADMINISTRATION FUNDS ARE BEING PASSED THROUGH FOR USE BY CAGUAS. F. $110000 - PROGRAM ADMINISTRATION. SALARIES AND EQUIPMENT.G. IN ADDITION PRHTA AS THE DESIGNATED RECIPIENT FOR THIS PROGRAM WILL APPLY FOR THE PROGRAM ADMINISTRATION FUNDS AS FOLLOW:*FY 2008 APPORTIONMENT ($3626498) ELIGIBLE 10%: $362469*FY 2009 APPORTIONMENT ($4256560) ELIGIBLE 10%: $425656*FY 2010 APPORTIONMENT ($4069771) ELIGIBLE 10%: $406977THESE PROJECTS WILL REMAIN IN CATEGORY B (AS IDENTIFIED IN THE POP) UNTIL THE TIP CAN BE AMENDED TO INCLUDE THESE PROJECTS. THE LRTP FOR SAN JUAN IS CURRENTLY LAPSED BUT ONCE THE UPDATE HAS BEEN APPROVED THE PROJECTS WILL BE AMENDED INTO THE TIP AS SOON AS POSSIBLE. PRHTA IS THE DESIGNATED RECIPIENT FOR ALL JARC APPORTIONMENTS IN PUERTO RICO INCLUDING THE LARGE URBANIZED AREAS OF SAN JUAN AND AGUADILLA. SAN JUAN APPORTIONMENTSFY2008: $3626498FY2009: $4256560FY2010: $4069771OF THOSE APPORTIONMENTS THIS APPLICATION WILL APPLY FOR $2185282. NO APPLICATIONS WERE RECEIVED FOR THE AGUADILLA UZA. PROJECT GOALS: THE CAGUAS JARC PROJECT IS AIMED AT A GOAL WHICH IS DIRECTLY CONSISTENT WITH THE AIMS AND PURPOSES OF THE JARC PROGRAM. THIS GOAL IS SUPPORTED BY THREE OBJECTIVES THAT MAKE THE GOAL ATTAINMENT VIABLE.THE PROJECT GOALS AND OBJECTIVES NOW FOLLOW.GOAL: THE JARC SYSTEM EXPECTS TO REACH A GOAL OF TRANSPORTING AT LEAST 300 PARTICIPANTS WEEKLY WITHIN THE FIRST 12-MONTHS OF THE IMPLEMENTATION PERIOD.OBJECTIVE 1: IN THE FIRST FOUR MONTHS WE WILL CONDUCT AN OUTREACH EFFORT TO THE POTENTIAL USERS OF THE JARC SYSTEM IN THE AREAS SURROUNDING THE DESIGNATED ROUTES.OBJECTIVE 2: IN THE FIRST SIX (6) MONTHS WE EXPECT TO PROMOTE THE ENROLLMENT OF AT LEAST 400 RIDERS IN THE SYSTEM.OBJECTIVE 3: IN THE FIRST NINE (9) MONTHS PROMOTE THAT AT LEAST 75% (300) OF RIDERS THAT ENROLLED CONTINUE USING THE JARC SYSTEM TO REACH THEIR WORKPLACES.COMPETITIVE SELECTION PROCESS:THE PRHTA AS THE DESIGNATED RECIPIENT IS RESPONSIBLE FOR CONDUCTING THE COMPETITIVE SELECTION PROCESS. (IN THE LARGE URBANIZED AREAS IN COOPERATION WITH THE MPO) THE SELECTION PROCESS WILL BE DERIVATE FROM THE COORDINATION PLAN AND COMPLY WITH THE PURPOSE OF THE PROGRAMS (5310 5316 AND 5317). THE WAY THE COMPETITIVE SELECTION PROCESS IS CONDUCTED IS AS FOLLOWS: -ANNUALLY NOTICES ARE PUBLISHED IN NEWSPAPERS OF GENERAL CIRCULATIONS AND OUR ON THE WEBPAGE TO INFORM THE GENERAL PUBLIC ABOUT THE AVAILABILITY OF FEDERAL FUNDS TO DEVELOP TRANSPORTATION RELATED PROJECTS FOR URBANIZED AREAS AS WELL AS SMALL URBAN AND RURAL AREAS THE PROGRAM REQUIREMENTS AND THE PROCESS FOR RECEIVING FUNDS. -PROVIDE INFORMATION DATES AND LOCATION OF THE REGIONAL TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE AND PLANNING MEETINGS.-NEXT THE PRHTA EVALUATE PROJECTS SUBMITTED FROM URBAN AND NON-URBANIZED AREAS USING THE SELECTION CRITERIA AS STATED BELOW:1. BE DERIVED FROM THE COORDINATED PLAN2. MEETS THE INTENT (SHOWN ABOVE) OF THE JARC PROGRAM3. IDENTIFICATION OF NEEDS AND SOLUTION THAT ADDRESS THE NEEDS4. COMPLETENESS OF THE REQUIRED DOCUMENTATION5. COMPLY WITH THE FOLLOWING PLANNING REQUIREMENTS:-METROPOLITAN PLANNING ORGANIZATION (MPO). APPLICANTS FROM AN URBANIZED AREA ARE REQUIRED TO NOTIFY THEIR RESPECTIVE MAYORS OF THEIR INTENTION TO SUBMIT AN APPLICATION. THE MAYOR WILL THEN SUBMIT A PETITION TO BE INCLUDED IN THE TRANSPORTATION IMPROVEMENT PROGRAM (TIP) WHICH IS PREPARED BY THE PRHTA.-PROJECTS IN NON URBANIZED AREA WILL BE INCORPORATED IN STIP.-THE SELECTED PROJECTS TO BE FUNDED BE ANNOUNCES.INITIALLY NO PETITIONS WERE RECEIVED FOR SECTION 5316/5317. AN ADDITIONAL CALL FOR PROJECTS WENT OUT EXTENDING THE DUE DATE TO SUBMIT A PROPOSAL FOR THESE PROGRAMS. PRHTA ENSURES THAT ALL PETITIONS COMPLY WITH THE GENERAL REQUIREMENTS FOR EACH PROGRAM. THE SMP HAS BEEN REVIEWED AND APPROVED BY FTA REGION IV AND IS ON FILE. THE APPROVAL LETTER FOR THAT PLAN IS ATTACHED TO THIS GRANT.

BERKS AREA REGIONAL TRANSPORTATION AUTHORITY (BARTA) INTENDS TO USE SECTION 5316 FUNDS APPORTIONED TO THE READING URBANIZED AREA (UZA) TOWARDS OPERATING ASSISTANCE FOR THE PERIOD OCTOBER 1 2015 THROUGH SEPTEMBER 30 2017 TO SUPPORT A JOB ACCESS AND REVERSE COMMUTE (JARC) PROGRAM WITHIN THE COUNTY OF BERKS.THIS GRANT UTILIZES FFY 2012 SECTION 5316 JARC FEDERAL PROGRAM FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $126169.OVERALL THE FUNDING IN THIS APPLICATION WILL BE USED FOR 1 RECIPIENT WHO IS A PUBLIC BODY AND WILL OPERATE THE SERVICE IN AN URBAN AREA. THE GOAL TO EXPAND SERVICE HOURS FOR BETTER JOB ACCESS COVERAGE AND TO INITIATE EMPLOYEE SHUTTLE SERVICES WERE GOALS AND STRATEGIES OUTLINED IN THE UPDATED HUMAN SERVICES PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION COORDINATION PLAN (2013) AS APPROVED BY THE READING AREA TRANSPORTATION STUDY (RATS) COORDINATING COMMITTEE ON 9/19/2013. GOALS OF THIS PLAN SPECIFICALLY ADDRESSED BY THIS PROJECT INCLUDE:1) EXPAND SERVICE CHARACTERISTICS (AREA HOURS ETC.) TO MEET NEEDS - SPECIFICALLY IN REGARDS TO SPECIFIC USER GROUPS GEOGRAPHICAL COVERAGE OR HOURS OF OPERATION FOR EMPLOYEES THAT CAN CURRENTLY ONLY HAVE ONE LEG OF THEIR COMMUTE TO JOBS PROVIDED BY EXISTING FIXED ROUTE PUBLIC TRANSIT (PAGE 32).2) PROMOTE MOBILITY OPTIONS TO INCREASE AWARENESS - AN ESENTIAL COMPONENT OF THIS PROJECT WOULD BE CROSS PROMOTION AND OUTREACH TO PROSPECTIVE EMPLOYEES AND ASSISTING IN ARRANGING TRAVEL IN ADVANCE THROUGH THE PARATRANSIT PROVIDER TO ACCOMODATE THESE TRIPS (PAGE 32).THE PROJECT WAS SUBMITTED TO THE RATS HUMAN SERVICES COORDINATING COMMITTEE ON 5/7/2014 IN RESPONSE TO A CALL FOR PROJECTS ISSUED ON 3/21/2014 AS PART OF THE COMPETITIVE SELECTION PROCESS. IT WAS RANKED AND RECOMMENDED BY THE HUMAN SERVICES COORDINATING COMMITTEE (NO OTHER APPLICATIONS WERE SUBMITTED) AND PRESENTED TO THE RATS TECHNICAL (5/1/2014) AND COORDINATING COMMITTEE (5/15/2014). IT WAS APPROVED BY THE RATS COORDINATING COMMITTEE ON 5/15/2014.THE FFY 2013-2016 TRANSPORTATION IMPROVEMENT PROGRAM (TIP) AND HUMAN SERVICES TRANSPORTATION COORDINATION PLAN (2013) ARE ATTACHED AS REFERENCE FOR THIS APPLICATION IN THE PROJECT INFORMATION PROJECT DETAILS FOLDER. FEDERAL FUNDS WILL COVER FIFTY PERCENT (50%) OF THE COSTS INCURRED FOR THE PROGRAMS OUTLINED IN THIS GRANT.THE 50% NON-FEDERAL MATCH OF $126169 WILL BE PROVIDED BY THE COMMONWEALTH OF PENNSYLVANIA AND THE COUNTY OF BERKS.

THIS IS A MASSACHUSETTS DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION (MASSDOT) SECTION 5316 JOB ACCESS AND REVERSE COMMUTE APPLICATION REPRESENTING A REQUEST OF $688637 FOR A PROGRAM OF PLANNING ASSISTANCE IN RURAL SMALL URBAN AND THE BOSTON UZA. TRANSPORTATION DEVELOPMENT (TOLL) CREDITS IN THE AMOUNT OF $137727 (20% OF THE TOTAL PROJECT) WILL BE USED TO DEFRAY THE LOCAL MATCH. ON MARCH 12 2010 THE FHWA MA DIVISION OFFICE APPROVED MASSDOTS REQUEST FOR USE OF UP TO $87.5 MILLION IN TOLL CREDITS TO DEFRAY THE NON-FEDERAL SHARE OF TRANSPORTATION PROJECTS IN THE COMMONWEALTH (LETTER ATTACHED). AS A RESULT THIS APPLICATION SHOWS 100% FEDERAL SHARE FOR THESE PROJECTS. ON BEHALF OF THE GOVERNOR MASSDOT WAS SELECTED TO BE THE DESIGNATED RECIPIENT OF JOB ACCESS AND REVERSE COMMUTE FUNDING WITHIN THE BOSTON UZA SMALL URBAN AREAS AND RURAL AREAS OF THE COMMONWEALTH. PROJECTS SELECTED FOR FUNDING WERE DERIVED FROM LOCALLY COORDINATED PUBLIC TRANSIT-HUMAN SERVICES TRANSPORTATION PLANS WHICH WERE DEVELOPED BY THE VARIOUS PLANNING AGENCIES REPRESENTED IN THE BOSTON UZA SMALL URBAN AREAS AND RURAL AREAS OF THE COMMONWEALTH IN CONJUNCTION WITH LOCAL INPUT. A NOTICE OF PROJECT SOLICITATION WAS SENT FROM MASSDOT TO THE AFFECTED PLANNING AGENCIES ON JANUARY 10 2013. THE NOTICE IDENTIFIED MARCH 1 2013 AS THE DEADLINE FOR SUBMISSION OF APPLICATIONS TO MASSDOT. THE INDIVIDUAL PLANNING AGENCIES SET THEIR DEADLINES BASED ON THE MASSDOT SCHEDULED REVIEW. ALL APPLICATIONS WERE SUBMITTED TO MASSDOT ON OR BEFORE MARCH 1 2013. ON MARCH 22 2013 ALL INVOLVED PLANNING AGENCIES WERE INVITED TO PRESENT A BRIEF SYNOPSIS OF THE APPLICATIONS RECEIVED BY THEIR AGENCIES RATED IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE PRIORITIES OF THE AREA TO A COMMITTEE MADE UP OF MASSDOT RAIL TRANSIT STAFF. MASSDOT COMPETITIVELY SELECTED PROJECTS FOR FUNDING. TWO (2) STATE-WIDE PROJECTS WERE SELECTED. THE SELECTED PROJECTS WILL UTILIZE FUNDS AS FOLLOWS:PROJECT #1:MASSACHUSETTS DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION RAIL TRANSIT DIVISION - STANDARDIZED TICKETING SCHEMES - THIS FUNDING WILL BE USED FOR A COMPREHENSIVE PLANNING ANALYSIS REGARDING THE IMPLEMENTATION AND TECHNICAL SPECIFICATIONS REQUIRED TO DEVELOP A STANDARDIZED TICKETING SCHEME FOR PUBLIC AND PRIVATE OPERATORS OF TRANSIT WHICH PROVIDE REVERSE COMMUTE TRAVEL OPTIONS TARGETING SERVICE TO OUTLYING LOW-INCOME AREAS AND PROVIDE JOB ACCESS TO SHIFT WORK - FFY11 BOSTON UZA $97108; FFY11 RURAL $2892. BUDGET REVISION DECEMBER 2021NCTD IS SUBMITTING THIS BUDGET REVISION TO CLARIFY THAT GRANT FUNDS WERE USED TO FUND IMPROVEMENTS AT THE POINSETTIA TRANSIT STATION (PTS) AND THE OCEANSIDE TRANSIT CENTER (OTC) IN ADDITION TO IMPROVEMENTS AT THE ESCONDIDO TRANSIT CENTER (ETC). THE GRANT ORIGINALLY IDENTIFIED IMPROVEMENTS ONLY AT ETC. $275923 OF FEDERAL FUNDS AND $68981 OF LOCAL FUNDS INCLUDED UNDER ALI 11.94.06 THAT WERE ORIGINALLY INTENDED FOR ETC CONSTRUCTION WERE INSTEAD USED TO FUND IMPROVEMENTS AT PTS AND OTC. THE ETC PROJECT WAS DESCOPED TO INCLUDE ETC WINDOWS DESIGN AND CONSTRUCTION AND HVAC REPAIR ONLY. FUNDS SAVED FROM ETC IMPROVEMENT PROJECT WERE REALLOCATED TO THE PTS AND OTC PROJECTS. THE IMPROVEMENT MADE ON PTS INCLUDED RESTROOM ENHANCEMENTS AND REPAIRS SIDEWALK REPAIR AND ROOF REPAIR. IN ADDITION TO THIS GRANT PTS IMPROVEMENTS PROJECT WAS FUNDED BY MULTIPLE FTA GRANTS (CA-03-0718 CA-90-Y632 CA-90-Y874 AND CA-90-Z200) AND LOCAL TDA AND STUF 07/08/09 MONEY FOR TOTAL AMOUNT OF $652840. THE IMPROVEMENT MADE ON OTC INCLUDED CUSTOMER SERVICE WINDOWS REPLACEMENT. THIS PROJECT WAS FUNDED ONLY WITH THIS GRANT AND REQUIRING LOCAL MATCH. THE PTS AND OTC ARE TWO OF THE MAJOR MULTI-MODAL HUBS USED DAILY BY LOW-INCOME COMMUTERS TO ACCESS JOBS IN THE SAN DIEGO COUNTY WIDE AREA. ALL WORK DONE ON THE PTS AND OTC IS DONE UNDER THE SAME ALI ORIGINALLY FUNDING THE ETC. THE ACTIVITIES AT PTS AND OTC ARE CONSISTENT WITH THE 2006 REGIONAL TRANSPORTATION IMPROVEMENT PROGRAM AMENDMENT 13 MPO ID NCTD07. THESE FUNDS WILL BE USED TO IMPROVE BUS STOPS AND TRANSIT STATIONS WITHIN THE CITY OF ESCONDIDO AS WELL AS INCREASING THE FREQUENCY OF SPRINTER WEEKEND SERVICE.THESE FUNDS ARE PROGRAMMED IN THE MOST RECENT FEDERALLY APPROVED RTIP (2006 AMENDMENT 13) DATED APRIL 16 2008.1.PROJECT DESCRIPTION/JUSTIFICATION: THIS GRANT IS REQUESTING JARC FUNDS IN THE TOTAL AMOUNT OF $1095680: JARC FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $782930 FOR THE IMPROVEMENT OF BUS STATIONS AND TRANSIT CENTERS IN THE CITY OF ESCONDIDO; AND JARC FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $312750 FOR THE DEVELOPMENT OF THE SPRINTER WEEKEND SERVICE PROGRAM. 2.LOCATION OF THE ACTIVITIES. THE PROJECTS ARE LOCATED IN NORTH SAN DIEGO COUNTY CALIFORNIA. 3.SERVICE PROVIDERS THAT USE THE PROJECT IN TRANSIT OPERATIONS:THE NORTH COUNTY TRANSIT DISTRICT MOVES MORE THAN 12 MILLION PASSENGERS ANNUALLY BY PROVIDING PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION FOR NORTH SAN DIEGO COUNTY. ITS FAMILY OF TRANSIT SERVICES CURRENTLY INCLUDES THE SPRINTER LIGHT RAIL SERVICE THE BREEZE BUS SYSTEM THE COASTER COMMUTER RAIL SERVICE FAST DEMAND RESPONSE SERVICE AND THE LIFT PARATRANSIT CURB-TO-CURB SERVICE. ADDITIONAL INFORMATION ON EACH OF THESE SERVICES IS PROVIDED BELOW.-NCTD SPRINTER LIGHT RAIL SERVICE: THE OCEANSIDE-TO-ESCONDIDO RAIL PROJECT (THE SPRINTER ) BEGAN SERVICE ON MARCH 9 2008 AND SERVICES A 22-MILE STRETCH OF THE EAST-TO-WEST CORRIDOR OF NORTH SAN DIEGO COUNTY. THE SPRINTER RUNS THROUGH THE CITIES OF OCEANSIDE VISTA SAN MARCOS ESCONDIDO AND PARTS OF THE COUNTY OF SAN DIEGO AND WILL SERVICE AN ESTIMATED 11600 PASSENGERS DAILY AFTER ONE YEAR OF OPERATION. -NCTD BREEZE FIXED ROUTE BUS SERVICE: NCTD OPERATES 53 BREEZE ROUTES SEVEN DAYS A WEEK UTILIZING A FLEET OF 165 BUSES AND 5 VANS AND SERVING AN ANNUAL RIDERSHIP OF APPROXIMATELY 10.2 MILLION.-NCTD COASTER COMMUTER RAIL SERVICE: THE COASTER COMMUTER RAIL SERVICE OPERATES ALONG THE COASTAL RAIL LINE SERVING THE COASTAL COMMUNITIES BETWEEN OCEANSIDE AND SAN DIEGO. COASTER SERVICE WHICH IS OPERATED BY TRANSITAMERICA SERVICES INC. (TASI) ON BEHALF OF NCTD RUNS MONDAY-SATURDAY AND SERVES A TOTAL OF EIGHT STATIONS WITH ITS FLEET OF SEVEN LOCOMOTIVES AND 28 BI-LEVEL PASSENGER TRAIN CARS. APPROXIMATELY 1.5 MILLION PASSENGERS ARE CARRIED BY THE COASTER EVERY YEAR.-NCTD FAST SERVICE: FAST SERVICE THE GENERAL PUBLIC DEMAND RESPONSE SERVICE OPERATES IN THE RURAL AREAS OF FALLBROOK AND RAMONA AS WELL AS VISTA. THIS SERVICE IS OPERATED BY LAIDLAW ON BEHALF OF NCTD AND SERVES APPROXIMATELY 103000 PASSENGERS ANNUALLY. DUE TO SIGNIFICANT DECREASES IN TRANSIT FUNDING AT THE STATE AND LOCAL LEVELS NCTD PLANS TO ELIMINATE THE FAST SERVICE BY THE END OF 2008.-NCTD LIFT SERVICE: LIFT PROVIDES CURB-TO-CURB LIFT-EQUIPPED TRANSPORTATION SERVICE FOR AMERICANS WITH DISABILITIES ACT (ADA) CERTIFIED PASSENGERS. ADA CERTIFIED PASSENGERS MAY CALL IN ADVANCE TO REQUEST RIDES. LIFT VANS ARE AVAILABLE ON THE SAME DAYS AND HOURS AND SERVE THE SAME AREAS AS NCTDS FIXED-ROUTE BUS SERVICE. PASSENGERS MUST LIVE WITHIN THE ADA DEFINED SERVICE AREA. THIS SERVICE IS OPERATED BY LAIDLAW ON BEHALF OF NCTD. LIFT HELPS APPROXIMATELY 84000 PEOPLE GET WHERE THEY NEED TO GO EACH YEAR. 4.OTHER TRANSIT PROVIDERS IN NCTDS SERVICE AREA:-AMTRAK INTERCITY RAIL: AMTRAK PROVIDES DAILY PASSENGER RAIL PACIFIC SURFLINER SERVICE ALONG THE LOS ANGELES-SAN DIEGO-SAN LUIS OBISPO RAIL CORRIDOR INCLUDING SERVICE STOPS IN OCEANSIDE SOLANA BEACH AND SAN DIEGO.-METROLINK: THE METROLINK ORANGE COUNTY LINE PROVIDES SERVICE MONDAY THROUGH FRIDAY FROM OCEANSIDE IN NORTHERN SAN DIEGO COUNTY TO ORANGE COUNTY AND DOWNTOWN LOS ANGELES.-GREYHOUND: GREYHOUND PROVIDES DAILY INTERCITY BUS SERVICE IN SAN DIEGO COUNTY INCLUDING STOPS AT OCEANSIDE ESCONDIDO AND SAN DIEGO.-LAIDLAW: THIS CONTRACTOR OPERATES LIFT ADA/PARATRANSIT SERVICE AND FAST DEMAND RESPONSE SERVICE ON BEHALF OF NCTD.5.ALL DOL CORRESPONDENCE TO NCTD SHOULD BE ADDRESSED TO DIANE HESSLER AT DHESSLER@NCTD.ORG.NCTD IS PART OF THE SAN DIEGO REGION IT ARCHITECTURE AND ITS PROJECTS ARE DEVELOPED USING A SYSTEMS ENGINEERING PROCESS.NCTDS METROPOLITAN PLANNING ORGANIZATION (MPO) IS SANDAG.
